sub_topic: Finding the inverse of a matrix
message_1:
Find the inverse of the matrix A = 

[3 1]

[2 4]
message_2:
To find the inverse of a 2x2 matrix A = [a b; c d], we use the formula:

A^(-1) = (1/determinant(A)) * [d -b; -c a]

First, we find the determinant of A:

determinant(A) = ad - bc = (3 * 4) - (1 * 2) = 12 - 2 = 10

Now, we can find the inverse of A:

A^(-1) = (1/10) * [4 -1; -2 3]

A^(-1) = [0.4 -0.1; -0.2 0.3]

So, the inverse of the matrix A is:

[0.4 -0.1]

[-0.2 0.3]
